maml:description.maml:para: Convert string in hex format to byte array
Convert string in hex format to byte array
String of hexadecimal characters, without "0x"
Debug output
Debug output
String of hexadecimal characters, without "0x"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The hexadecimal string "cafebabe" was converted to a byte array: 0xCA -> 202, 0xFE -> 252, 0xBA -> 186, 0xBE -> 190

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Find-ZPkiAdAttributeSchema samaccountname
DistinguishedName : CN=ms-DS-Additional-Sam-Account-Name,CN=Schema,CN=Configuration,DC=zwks,DC=xyz ObjectGuid : c2e25b99-4118-4dfc-aa69-585ec87138d4 Name : ms-DS-Additional-Sam-Account-Name CommonName : ms-DS-Additional-Sam-Account-Name LdapDisplayName : msDS-AdditionalSamAccountName ObjectGuid : c2e25b99-4118-4dfc-aa69-585ec87138d4 SchemaIdGuid : 975571df-a4d5-429a-9f59-cdc6581d91e6 AttributeSecurityGuid : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 PropertySets : {} IsSingleValued : False OmSyntax : 64 OmObjectClass : SystemFlags : None SystemOnly : AttributeSyntax : String(Unicode); Unicode string (2.5.5.12)
DistinguishedName : CN=SAM-Account-Name,CN=Schema,CN=Configuration,DC=zwks,DC=xyz ObjectGuid : b47e7255-a601-4144-8e92-d19a902636de Name : SAM-Account-Name CommonName : SAM-Account-Name LdapDisplayName : sAMAccountName ObjectGuid : b47e7255-a601-4144-8e92-d19a902636de SchemaIdGuid : 3e0abfd0-126a-11d0-a060-00aa006c33ed AttributeSecurityGuid : 59ba2f42-79a2-11d0-9020-00c04fc2d3cf PropertySets : {CN=General-Information,CN=Extended-Rights,CN=Configuration,DC=zwks,DC=xyz} IsSingleValued : True OmSyntax : 64 OmObjectClass : SystemFlags : None SystemOnly : AttributeSyntax : String(Unicode); Unicode string (2.5.5.12)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for attributeSchema objects in the schema partition. Searches match on substring so "samaccountname" will match both "samaccountname" and "msDS-AdditionalSamAccountName".

maml:description.maml:para: Search AD for objects.

This cmdlet can search AD for objects matching LDAP filter. Use -LdapFilter, -SearchBase, -SearchScope, and -Properties like you would with the MS ActiveDirectory module. This cmdlet will attempt to print attributes in human-readable form where the MS ActiveDirectory prints raw data, such as lastlogontimestamp and useraccountcontrol attributes.
Credential for connecting. Default on Windows is logged on user. On non-Windows platforms, this is mandatory.
Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Ldap query filter
Select properties to return
Resolve SIDs, GUIDs and ExtendedRights when returning object security
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Ldap query search root
Search scope. Must be Base, OneLevel, or Subtree.
Force use of the specified Active Directory site.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Credential for connecting. Default on Windows is logged on user. On non-Windows platforms, this is mandatory.
Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.

Debug output

Select properties to return
Resolve SIDs, GUIDs and ExtendedRights when returning object security
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Ldap query search root
Search scope. Must be Base, OneLevel, or Subtree.
Force use of the specified Active Directory site.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $RootDse = Get-ZPkiAdRootDse PS C:\> Find-ZPkiAdObject -SearchBase $RootDse.defaultnamingcontext -SearchScope Subtree -LdapFilter "(objectClass=user)"

dev:remarks.maml:para: First, get the RootDSE and use the information to search in the default domain partition for all user objects.

maml:description.maml:para: Find OID registrations in AD. Retrieve all OIDs, or filter by type and/or name.

Search objects under CN=OID, CN=Public Key Services, CN=Services in the AD forests' configuration partition. Can filter by type (template, application policy, or issuance policy) and/or by displayName.
Credential for connecting. Default on Windows is logged on user. On non-Windows platforms, this is mandatory.
Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for certificates in local windows stores

Search for certificates matching SearchFor parameter. SearchFor will match: 1. Serial number (exact match only) 2. Thumbprint (exact match only) 3. Subject name (substring match) 4. Subject Alternative Name (substring match)
By default searching will be done in CurrentUser\My certificate store. Use GlobalSearch to search in all stores and all store locations.
Search string
Debug output
Search in all stores and locations
Search string
Debug output
Certificate store location
Certificate store name
Debug output
Search in all stores and locations
Search string
Certificate store location
Certificate store name

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for certs in LocalMachine\My store for certs matching 'myserver.com'
Search for certs in all local stores in both CurrentUser and LocalMachine for certs matching 'myserver.com'

maml:description.maml:para: Get AD forest information
Get basic information about an AD forest, including: - fSMO masters - partitions - global catalogs
et cetera. This cmdlet shows the same information as Get-AdForest from Microsoft's ActiveDirectory module.
Credential for connecting. Default on Windows is logged on user. On non-Windows platforms, this is mandatory.
Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Force use of the specified Active Directory site.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.

Force use of the specified Active Directory site.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Retrieve or generate the Windows generated OID for the AD forest.

When creating new templates and OIDs in AD, Windows will use a unique OID for your forest. This value is generated when the first template or OID object is created, and is stored on the OID container in AD. This cmdlet can retrieve this value, or generate it if no templates have been created yet.
Credential for connecting. Default on Windows is logged on user. On non-Windows platforms, this is mandatory.
Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.

Force use of the specified Active Directory site.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ZPkiAdObject "CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=OZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz"
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get User by distinguished name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> "CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=OZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz" | Get-ZPkiAdObject
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: get User by distinguished name via pipeline input

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Find-ZPkiAdObject -ldapfilter "(samaccountname=justauser)" | Get-ZPkiAdObject
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: get User by distinguished name via pipeline input. You can pipe in an object with a DistinguishedName property

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ZPkiAdObject -ObjectGuid 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: get User by ObjectGuid

maml:description.maml:para: Get RootDSE for Active Directory. Use parameters to control which domain to connect to.

If run without parameters, cmdlet will connect to computer's joined domain. If -UserDomain is supplied, the cmdlet will connect to calling user's domain. Using -Domain or -DomainController you can connect to specific DC's, or to another domain in the forest, or any trusted forest.
Default is to connect to ADWS. Use -Rpc if you need to connect via RPC instead.
Credential for connecting. Default on Windows is logged on user. On non-Windows platforms, this is mandatory.
Use only DNS for AD infrastructure discovery. Do not use Win32/DirectoryServices API.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ZPkiAdUser "CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=OZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz"
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get User by distinguished name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> "CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=OZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz" | Get-ZPkiAdUser
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: get User by distinguished name via pipeline input

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Find-ZPkiAdObject -ldapfilter "(samaccountname=justauser)" | Get-ZPkiAdUser
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: get User by distinguished name via pipeline input. You can pipe in an object with a DistinguishedName property

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ZPkiAdUser -ObjectGuid 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd
DistinguishedName : CN=Just A User,OU=Employees,OU=Users,OU=ZWCORP,DC=zwks,DC=xyz UserPrincipalName : just.a.user@zampleworks.com Mail : just.a.user@zampleworks.com DisplayName : Just A User Name : Just A User SamAccountName : justauser CommonName : Just A User UserAccountControl : Normal_Acct PwdLastSet : 1/18/2021 10:43:59 AM Sid : S-1-5-21-169007554-561555583-3465870065-1516 ObjectGuid : 914fa5fe-74cf-4230-84c0-caea93c37acd WhenCreated : 4/8/2020 12:09:07 PM WhenChanged : 4/15/2025 2:25:37 PM

maml:description.maml:para: Parse DER encoded ASN.1 data

Parses DER encoded ASN.1 data from a file or byte array. File can be either binary DER encoded or optionally base64 (PEM) encoded. Returns a PS object or a text blob representing the ASN.1 document. This parser does not currently interpret any context specific tags. Only Universal tags are understood.
Byte array of ASN.1 encoded data
Return text representation of ASN.1 data instead of an object

maml:description.maml:para: Query ADCS Db
Query ADCS database for rows matching given filters. You can query the request table, CRL table, or extensions table.
ADCS instance config string. Find CAs with Get-ZPkiAdCasConfigString
Debug output

Limit results to requests matching the given filters. Valid syntax: <DbColumnName><operator><value>. Operators: [==, >, >=, <, <=]. Valid DbColumnNames are any returned by 'Get-ZPkiDbSchema'. You can also sort on the selected column by prepending the filter with '+' (ascending sort) or '-' (descending).
Maximum number of rows to fetch at a time. Default 50 000

Properties to include in output. Use "*" to include all columns. If you specify columns, the default columns are omitted. Default columns: RequestID, Request.Disposition, Request.RequesterName, CommonName, NotBefore, NotAfter, SerialNumber.
Database table to query. 'Cert', 'Ext', 'Attr', and 'Crl' are valid values.
ADCS instance config string. Find CAs with Get-ZPkiAdCasConfigString
Debug output

Limit results to requests matching the given filters. Valid syntax: <DbColumnName><operator><value>. Operators: [==, >, >=, <, <=]. Valid DbColumnNames are any returned by 'Get-ZPkiDbSchema'. You can also sort on the selected column by prepending the filter with '+' (ascending sort) or '-' (descending).
Maximum number of rows to fetch at a time. Default 50 000

Properties to include in output. Use "*" to include all columns. If you specify columns, the default columns are omitted. Default columns: RequestID, Request.Disposition, Request.RequesterName, CommonName, NotBefore, NotAfter, SerialNumber.
Database table to query. 'Cert', 'Ext', 'Attr', and 'Crl' are valid values.

maml:description.maml:para: Generate cn for an OID object

OID objects in the config partition in AD have their cn attribute set to a specific format based on the OID registered in the object's msPKI-Cert-Template-OID attribute. This cmdlet will generate the CN string from a given OID.
This OID will be converted to form used for OID object names in forest OID Container.
Debug output
This OID will be converted to form used for OID object names in forest OID Container.

maml:description.maml:para: List network ports/pipe addresses for well known services. Can query RPC Endpoint mapper for runtime ports for services that dynamically allocates ports for RPC/DCOM access. Currently only Active Directory is defined.

The intention of this cmdlet is to generate input to the Test-ZPkiServiceBinding cmdlet to test network connectivity to given services. UDP ports are excluded since there is no simple way to test UPD ports without knowing the specific application listening. RPC ports are excluded by default since it requires a round-trip to the server in question.
Debug output
Query Endpoint mapper for ports used by RPC-based AD services
Include UDP ports
Do not include TCP ports
Domain Controller to query for RPC ports
Return port set for given service
Maximum time to wait for connection (milliseconds)
Debug output
Query Endpoint mapper for ports used by RPC-based AD services
Include UDP ports
Do not include TCP ports
Domain Controller to query for RPC ports
Return port set for given service
Maximum time to wait for connection (milliseconds)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of all TCP static port services used by Active Directory. UDP and RPC ports are not included.

Get a list of all TCP static port services used by Active Directory. UDP ports are not included. Also queries the RPC Endpoint Mapper on the server and retrieves dynamic ports allocated to AD services.

maml:description.maml:para: Test connectivity to a service bound to a TCP port.
Use to test connectivity to services bound to TCP ports. Use this by specifying bindings manually, or by using the output from Get-ZPkiServiceBinding cmdlet.
Test single binding
Computer to try connecting to. Required if Bindings do not have a hostname set. Overrides value from Binding.
Debug output
Test multiple bindings
Computer to try connecting to. Required if Bindings do not have a hostname set. Overrides value from Binding.
Debug output
Test single binding
Test multiple bindings
Computer to try connecting to. Required if Bindings do not have a hostname set. Overrides value from Binding.
Debug output

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-ZPkiServiceBindings -Service ActiveDirectory -IncludeRpcPorts -QueryRpcServer server1 | Test-ZPkiServiceBinding -Computer server1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of static and dynamic port bindings for AD running on server1 and test if a simple TCP connection can be established. (The comma and parenthesis are included to force powershell to send the bindings to the pipeline as an array, instead of unrolling and piping each binding individually. This allows Test-ZPkiServiceBinding to parallelize the connection attempts)

maml:description.maml:para: Test TLS connection and return server certificate
Test TLS connection and return server certificate. Optionally save certificate to file.
URI to connect to
Save server certificate to file
Debug output
If set, no validation of server certificates will be performed
Port for TCP connection
TLS version to use. By default 1.3 is attempted first, then 1.2. If none works, and error is returned. Additional/other versions can be specified with this parameter
Set timeout value for connection, in ms. Default is 5000. 0 means no timeout.
Save server certificate to file
Debug output
If set, no validation of server certificates will be performed
